NAS Member |religion = Jewish }} '''Dr. Ronald Freedman''' was an international demographer and founder of the [[Population Studies Center at the University of Michigan]]. He led pioneering survey research on fertility in Asia. Freedman was the recipient of many honors and awards over his career. He was a [[Guggenheim Fellow]], a [[Fulbright Fellow]], President of the [[Population Association of America]], a member of the [[United States National Academy of Sciences|National Academy of Sciences]],{{cite web |url=http://www.nasonline.org/site/Dir/259724116?pg=vprof&mbr=1002810 |title=Ronald Freedman elected to NAS, 1974 |accessdate=2008-07-08 }} winner of the Irene B. Taeuber Award{{cite web |url=http://www.popassoc.org/i4a/pages/index.cfm?pageid=3306 |title=Ronald Freedman wins Irene B. Taeuber Award, 1981 |accessdate=2008-07-08 }} from the Population Association of America and the [[Office of Population Research]]. He was also a Laureate of the International Union for the Scientific Study of Population (IUSSP).[http://www.iussp.org/ IUSSP.org]{{cite web |url=http://www.iussp.org/Awards/12-freedman.php |title=Ronald Freedman 2002 IUSSP Laureate |accessdate=2008-07-08 }} Freedman died on November 21, 2007 in [[Ann Arbor|Ann Arbor, Michigan]], [[Michigan]] at the age of 90. ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://www.psc.isr.umich.edu/ UM Population Studies Center ] * [http://www.psc.isr.umich.edu/events/archive/2007/freedmanObit.html Ronald Freedman Obituary ] {{Authority control}} {{Persondata | NAME = Freedman, Ronald | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American demographer | DATE OF BIRTH = 1917-08-08 | PLACE OF BIRTH = unknown | DATE OF DEATH = 2007-11-21 | PLACE OF DEATH = [[Ann Arbor, Michigan|Ann Arbor]], [[Michigan]] }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Freedman, Ronald}} [[Category:American demographers]] [[Category:Fellows of the American Statistical Association]] [[Category:1917 births]] [[Category:2007 deaths]] [[Category:Members of the United States National Academy of Sciences]] [[Category:Guggenheim Fellows]] [[Category:University of Michigan staff]]
